bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Sarah Mathews was an American Red Cross worker stationed in Siberia from 1918 to 1920.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Memoirs, diary, correspondence, clippings, photographs, and oral history with transcript relating to the disposition of the remains of Tsar Nicholas II and his family, social and political conditions in Siberia, and relief work of the American Red Cross in Siberia during the Russian Civil War.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes various autobiographical drafts and fictional pieces written by Mathews relating to her experiences in Siberia.

did.unittitle: Transcript of interview by Stephen I. Zetterberg,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 57 photos of activities of the American Red Cross and the American Expeditionary Forces (A.E.F.) in Siberia (Vladivostok). Includes photo of General William S. Graves and Grigorii M. Semenov.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains clippings and publications relating to the American Red Cross and Russian refugees in Siberia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photo album with 231 photos and corresponding index relating to the American Red Cross and the A.E.F. in Siberia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains an oral history interview of Sarah E. Mathews by Stephen I. Zetterberg.
Audiovisual note: The sound quality of the interview is poor on the accessioned cassette. The program suffers from quite audible wow and flutter.
